description: Creates a new image recipe. Image recipes define how images are configured, tested, and assessed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the image recipe.

parameters.name: semanticVersion
parameters.description: The semantic version of the image recipe. This version follows the semantic version syntax.

parameters.name: components
parameters.description: The components included in the image recipe. (dict) --- Configuration details of the component. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component. parameters (list) --- A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe. (dict) --- Contains a key/value pair that sets the named component parameter. The name of the component parameter to set. Sets the value for the named component parameter. (string) ---

nested_params.name: componentArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

nested_params.name: parameters
nested_params.description: A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the component parameter to set.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: Sets the value for the named component parameter.

parameters.name: parentImage
parameters.description: The base image of the image recipe. The value of the string can be the ARN of the base image or an AMI ID. The format for the ARN follows this example: arn:aws:imagebuilder:us-west-2:aws:image/windows-server-2016-english-full-base-x86/x.x.x. You can provide the specific version that you want to use, or you can use a wildcard in all of the fields. If you enter an AMI ID for the string value, you must have access to the AMI, and the AMI must be in the same Region in which you are using Image Builder.

parameters.name: blockDeviceMappings
parameters.description: The block device mappings of the image recipe. (dict) --- Defines block device mappings for the instance used to configure your image. deviceName (string) --- The device to which these mappings apply. ebs (dict) --- Use to manage Amazon EBS-specific configuration for this mapping. encrypted (boolean) --- Use to configure device encryption. deleteOnTermination (boolean) --- Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device. iops (integer) --- Use to configure device IOPS. kmsKeyId (string) --- Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device. snapshotId (string) --- The snapshot that defines the device contents. volumeSize (integer) --- Use to override the device's volume size. volumeType (string) --- Use to override the device's volume type. throughput (integer) --- For GP3 volumes only --- The throughput in MiB/s that the volume supports. virtualName (string) --- Use to manage instance ephemeral devices. noDevice (string) --- Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

nested_params.name: deviceName
nested_params.description: The device to which these mappings apply.

nested_params.name: ebs
nested_params.description: Use to manage Amazon EBS-specific configuration for this mapping.

nested_params.name: deleteOnTermination
nested_params.description: Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyId
nested_params.description: Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device.

nested_params.name: snapshotId
nested_params.description: The snapshot that defines the device contents.

nested_params.name: volumeSize
nested_params.description: Use to override the device's volume size.

nested_params.name: volumeType
nested_params.description: Use to override the device's volume type.

nested_params.name: virtualName
nested_params.description: Use to manage instance ephemeral devices.

nested_params.name: noDevice
nested_params.description: Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags of the image recipe. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: additionalInstanceConfiguration
parameters.description: Specify additional settings and launch scripts for your build instances. systemsManagerAgent (dict) --- Contains settings for the Systems Manager agent on your build instance. uninstallAfterBuild (boolean) --- Controls whether the Systems Manager agent is removed from your final build image, prior to creating the new AMI. If this is set to true, then the agent is removed from the final image. If it's set to false, then the agent is left in, so that it is included in the new AMI. The default value is false. userDataOverride (string) --- Use this property to provide commands or a command script to run when you launch your build instance. The userDataOverride property replaces any commands that Image Builder might have added to ensure that Systems Manager is installed on your Linux build instance. If you override the user data, make sure that you add commands to install Systems Manager, if it is not pre-installed on your base image.

nested_params.name: systemsManagerAgent
nested_params.description: Contains settings for the Systems Manager agent on your build instance.

nested_params.name: uninstallAfterBuild
nested_params.description: Controls whether the Systems Manager agent is removed from your final build image, prior to creating the new AMI. If this is set to true, then the agent is removed from the final image. If it's set to false, then the agent is left in, so that it is included in the new AMI. The default value is false.

nested_params.name: userDataOverride
nested_params.description: Use this property to provide commands or a command script to run when you launch your build instance. The userDataOverride property replaces any commands that Image Builder might have added to ensure that Systems Manager is installed on your Linux build instance. If you override the user data, make sure that you add commands to install Systems Manager, if it is not pre-installed on your base image.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure idempotency of the request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency in the Amazon EC2 API Reference. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: requestId
nested_items.description: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

nested_items.name: clientToken
nested_items.description: The client token that uniquely identifies the request.

nested_items.name: imageRecipeArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that was created by this request.
